JobTitle: Manager/Sr. Manager - Platform Governance - Digital Platforms & APIs
JobFullDesc:
Global Commercial Services (GCS) is the global leader in providing payments solutions for Small, Medium, Large and Global businesses. The mission of the Business Financing and Supplier Payments (BFSP) team within GCS is to deliver a suite of payments solutions that make us the best choice for our customers. We achieve this by being customer first, delivering market leading value, and creating great experiences for our customers.

As our customers are changing the way they work and pay, we have been evolving with them by developing B2B partner-embedded and automated payment solutions so that we are seamlessly integrated into their ecosystem. The B2B Networks & Automation team is focused on building a new business model, key partnerships, value propositions, and go-to-market plans that will address all customer segments by leveraging AXP platforms as well as industry-leading Fintech capabilities to develop an API catalog offering a suite of payments & value-added services, connecting B2B trade, data, and financial services in a single digital environment. The team continues to develop this busines model through a wide variety of new capabilities, external partnerships and most recently through the acquisition of AcomPay to create the new proprietary One AP product.

The role

The Manager, Digital B2B Product Development will report into the Director, Digital B2B Product Development and lead the execution of next generation digital products in alignment with the strategic roadmap and vision across capabilities and products, primarily ACH for the Full File initiative.
 
The Digital Platform Governance Manager will be responsible for maturing and managing our business governance program to ensure that the business is meeting all governance requirements in addition to driving and managing the business’s operational strategy supporting our banking and ACH products. This role is critical in sustaining and accelerating the growth of our B2B business and requires a passion for working in a dynamic environment. The manager will collaborate closely with Governance stakeholders, Product Development, Servicing, Technology, and Partnership teams to ensure successful execution of activities that deliver and maintain our service offerings. 

Job Responsibilities:

Create and drive business governance and regulatory strategy in alignment with overall business strategy to enable scale and growth
Manage AP Automation PRSA & Governance activities including management of internal and external audits 
Drive continuous improvement of the ACH product offerings and operational strategy to meet enterprise and external control obligations, drive issue resolution, and maintain & automate internal reconciliations processes
Drive maturity Business Data Retention & Purge Program 


Drive automation of governance, audit and reconciliation activities capabilities with downstream teams and external stakeholders


Collaborate with Product Owners to shape ACH and governance product and capability roadmaps in alignment with business governance maturity and strategy to improve operational experience 


Communicate with stakeholders and senior leaders on governance requirements, issue resolution and operational/regulatory impacts to product decisions


Strong understanding of banking, accounting, governance and regulatory environments and needs
Curiosity and hunger to know how things work and ability to use that knowledge to find enhancement opportunities
Ability to build relationships across various stakeholders and influence without authority on high visibility projects
Entrepreneurial and strategic mindset, with a sense of urgency, positive attitude and the ability to excel in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment
Results-driven mindset with the ability to drive change management, navigate through ambiguity, and balance multiple priorities
Exceptional interpersonal, communication and conflict resolution skills
Keen attention to detail, high degree of accountability and integrity
Strong project management and organizational skills with proven record managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders
Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data to drive decisions, improve products and solve complex business problems
Proven ability to define a set of requirements that pinpoint business challenges and identify changes required to address them
Experience working in Agile with a tech team to develop digital products
Strong sense of urgency and customer-orientation to drive the best experiences for our partners and users

 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
